snippet: A suicide bomber struck a crowded square in Sana, the capital, killing more than 40 people in an attack thought to be aimed at supporters of a Shiite rebel group.
abstract: Suicide bomber attacks crowded square in Yemeni capital Sana, killing at least 47 people in an attack thought to be aimed at supporters of a Shiite rebel group Houthis.

byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Mursitpinar, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: A suicide bomber struck a crowded square in Sana, the capital, killing more than 40 people in an attack thought to be aimed at supporters of a Shiite rebel group.

headline.main: Fear of Sunni Extremists Grows After Fatal Blast in Yemen’s Capital
headline.print_headline: Fear of Sunni Extremists Grows After Fatal Blast in Yemen’s Capital
